definition[0]: if a business goes under, it has to stop operating because of financial problems
example[0]: More than 7,000 businesses have gone under in the last three months.
definition[1]: to sink beneath the surface of water
example[2]: She went under, coughing and spluttering.
definition[2]: if a business goes under, it fails because of financial difficulties
example[3]: As their smaller competitors go under, the large home-building companies grab more and more of the market.
